intro: Tylophora hybostemma var. pilipes, commonly known as the hairy tylophora, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by orange-red berries. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it notable for its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses.
